result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Gage Daniels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: the sentence the defendant is currently serving in Forest County case 20CF237.

miscConds.notes: To be collected through the Clerk of Court's Office. A six month commitment order will be imposed, due to non-payment and is to run consecutive to any sentence defendant may be serving at that time.
To be collected through the Clerk of Court's Office.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations. The defendant must attend at least one AA/NA or similar type meeting per week.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No consumption or possession of alcohol. Defendant must not possess or consume marijuana in any jurisdiction. No entry into any bars or taverns.
Defendant must take any medication that may be prescribed by a treating physician or medical care provider and is to be taken in the manner in which it is prescribed.

The defendant must undergo an anger management assessment and follow through with any and all recommendations. Defendant must undergo a Psychological/Mental Health evaluation and follow through with any and all recommendations.

timeConds.notes: to be completed within the first year of probation.

Jail term is stayed. Defendant must make all arrangements and appointments for AODA, anger management, mental health evaluation and must obtain a job within the first 60 days of probation. If defendant does not comply, stay will be lifted and defendant will be required to serve jail time until the assessments are completed and a job obtained. Good time and Huber allowed if jail term is imposed.

supervisions.notes:
Same conditions as count 2 with no additional community service hours.
Concurrent with: Count 2 but consecutive to the sentence in 20CF237.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Gage Daniels

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis
Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: 11:01 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Gage Daniels appeared in person, in custody from FC jail.  Attorney Daniel Terry Cveykus in court for Michael Gage Daniels. Called 22CF237 and 22CF72. State on 22CF237 SEHR. Cveykus has received summary, recommendation of writer incorrect max time should be 9 months. Court also makes note of the credit indicated - if revoked 2 days credit in minutes not on JOC. State is asking for 9 months on sole count with 83 days sentence credit. Cveykus makes statement asking for 6 months with 85 days sentence credit. Court questions revocation summary. Cveykus responds. Daniels makes statement, remorseful. Court has considered all statements, revocation summary, considered all factors, sentences to 7 months in FC jail, gives credit for 85 days, Huber and good time allowed consistent with the sheriff's rules and regulations. Appeal rights given. Court now calls 22CF72 - same appearances. State believes resolution. Cveykus indicates agreement: count 1 - DRI; plead guilty to counts 2, 3 and 5. DRI count 4. 2 years probation concurrent on all charges but consecutive to sentence currently serving, fine of $500 plus costs on count 2, Conditions AODA and follow through, anger management and follow through, obtain mental health evaluation and follow through, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol, no possession or use of MJ, no entry into any bars or taverns, obtain FT employment,  40 hours of community service, take all meds as prescribed and all over the counter meds as prescribed. Victim rights have been complied with as Cveykus has contacted them. State has complied with victim rights - no one wished to participate. Court questions who the victims were. State recites names on the record. Daniels agrees with recommendation recited. Court makes sure defendant understands what it means to have a count DRI. Daniels understands. Court DRI count 1 and 4. Daniels pleads guilty to count 2, 3 and 5. Court has plea questionnaire and goes over the form with defendant, finds he is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering his plea, waiving his constitutional rights and right to trial. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea of guilty and adjudges guilty of counts 2, 3 and 5 all as alleged. State makes final statement and asks court to follow joint recommendation. Cveykus makes statement, has spoken with victims and asks court to follow joint recommendation. Daniels with hold comment. Court has considered all statements and factors, will accept joint recommendation and sentences to the following:  Counts 2, 3 and 5 with hold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to each count but consecutive to the sentence the defendant is currently serving on 20CF237. Conditions of probation: AODA and follow through with all recommendation, anger management assessment and follow through with any treatment plans, obtain mental health evaluation and follow through with any and all recommendations, no consumption or possession of alcohol, no possession or consumption of marijuana in any jurisdiction, no entry into any bars or taverns, must obtain one AA/NA or similar type meeting per week, obtain FT employment, 40 hours of community service with in the first year of probation, take all medication in the matter as they are prescribed by medical provider. Also imposes and stays a 6 months sentence in the FC jail, with Huber and good time, stayed by making all arrangements/appointments for AODA, anger management and mental health evaluation and must obtain a job within the first 60 days of probation. If not followed, stay will be lifted until defendant completes those assessments and obtains a job. Imposes fine of $1000 plus costs on each count - 60 DTP/CO to be collected through the COC office. DNA sample with surcharges. Appeal rights given. No credit if revoked.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:21 PM Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Gage Daniels appeared by video, in custody from FC jail.  Attorney Daniel Terry Cveykus in court for Michael Gage Daniels. State believes the PH is proceeding and calls first witness, Sgt. Connor Johnson. Sworn in, 2:21 PM. State directs. Record reflects proper identification of defendant, 2:28 PM. State advises the court that count 2 will be amended to misd battery. Court asks to file an amended information. Cveykus cross-examines, 2:29 PM. State - objection - foundation - over ruled, 2:30 PM. Witness excused, 2:31 PM. Court finds probable cause, binds over for trial, amended information will be filed. State indicates will be amended as indicated on the record with modifier. Cveykus goes over amended information on the record with his defendant, Daniels understands. Cveykus with understanding amended information will be filed as stated, will proceed to ARGN, waives reading and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, instructs the state to file amended information within 24 hours, set for JT, if resolved call for PLEAS date and continues bond.

Preliminary hearing on May 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

09:08 AM Defendant Michael Gage Daniels appears by video from FC jail with attorney Daniel Cveykus appearing by zoom. Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court Commissioner appears by zoom. Cveykus complaint filed yesterday has not went over the complaint but feels he understands the charges and penalties, waives formal reading and asks for PH, bond has been set, willing to waive time limits for PH. Court considered time limits waived, continues bond and will have set for PH. Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
No contact with Dallan Crossbear, Jake Maxwell or Daniel Hill
